title: IoT-Based Cyber-Physical Interaction Programming Education Course

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Programming Concepts, Foundational Knowledge in Physics and Mathematics
context.additional_context: Students experiment with cyber-physical interactions using personal smartphones as controllers and implement 3D animations via VPython. Conducted as blended learning combining offline activities and online programming

learning_goals: Students can create 3D animation programs controllable via smartphones using an IoT platform
Students apply physics concepts to cyber-physical systems to complete programming projects linked to real-world phenomena
Students understand the fundamentals of digital twin development and can design science fair projects
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
